Job Title: Sr. Director, Surgical Strategic Accounts

Location: United States

Employment Type: full-time

Listed Skills: Business Development, Sales

Description:
Careers that Change Lives

The Sr Director, Surgical Strategic Accounts will ensure strategic alignment with the $2.3B MDT Surgical business and its commercial priorities. Accountable to the growth of the aligned strategic accounts, this critical leader will lead a team of five Directors, Strategic Accounts who will own an estimated $500M of surgical business and 50 of the most key Surgical account and opportunities.This team will focus on driving account security and category expansion across the entire Surgical portfolio and work to lay the groundwork for future portfolio innovation. This team will serve as the foremost experts of pricing, contracting, GPOs, and understand the national contracting and competitive landscape at the highest level.They will be responsible for reporting the market landscape to the Surgical LT and commercial organization on a quarterly basis and present a business plan inclusive of key metrics that define contract health and profitability. This position will report directly to the VP, US Surgical Commercial Excellence.

As a member of the US Surgical Leadership team, this role will bring key market insights to inform strategic decision-making for the Surgical business and yield strong financial acumen related to rebates, margin profiles, price optimization and mix. This role will provide one voice and one consolidated approach for pricing strategy, contracting, and partnership management that will be executed through the team of Directors, Strategic Accounts and the surgical regions.This leader will own key customer executive relationships that may influence and inform negotiations and market approach. This leader will serve as a primary liaison with all key pricing and contracting stakeholders including RVP, Portfolio Managers, Contracts, Offer Development and will partner tightly with the Medtronic Enterprise Accounts and GPO teams.

 Preferred location is any major US city with access to major airport


 Sales Execution 

 Own and model the Surgical portfolio messaging to influence competitive differentiation and drive maximum portfolio economic and clinical value in the market. Drive creation and execution of the right sales reporting, analytics and KPIs that ensure realization of goals and organizational visibility. Drive U.S. Surgical revenue and market share growth through the development of strategic account strategy and lead strong execution in partnership with the field sales teams.  Partner tightly with the Surgical sales leadership team to ensure aligned objectives and seamless operating mechanism that drive achievement of sales quotas.  Drive strategy and execution in alignment with the Surgical Commercial Priorities.  Own and develop relationships with executive stakeholders in identified strategic account alignment; Lead key customer presentation activities in most prioritized negotiations, business reviews, etc.  Leverage new products and innovations to drive increased customer engagement and category expansion; Ensure all strategic products are appropriately positioned in contracts and strategic accounts. 


 People Leadership 

 Responsible for leading team of 5 Directors, Strategic Accounts aligned to each of the 5 regions, each with $100M in aligned account revenue. Demonstrate strong talent leadership through accountable performance management and talent development. Accountable to influencing and striving for optimal organization health and positive culture reflected through ongoing OHS insights and metrics. Responsible for driving tight alignment between the aligned region LT, sales teams and the Directors, Strategic Accounts to ensure a comprehensive partnership approach.


 Business Collaboration 

 Develop and drive creative and effective financial/contracting solutions that align with business objectives and create differentiation with the customer and market.  Serve as the US Surgical foremost expert of pricing, contracting, GPOs, and understand the national contracting and competitive landscape at the highest level.  Collaborate with cross-functional team members including marketing, finance, contracting team, sales LT to develop new sales programs to meet customer financial objectives.  Collaborate with US Strategic Accounts leadership, Sales Vice Presidents, Sr Sales Directors, Region Managers, and Marketing on initiatives that effect the field and assist in the execution of these key initiatives.  Provide primary voice and one consolidated approach for pricing strategy, contracting, and partnership management that will be executed through the team of Directors, Strategic Accounts and the surgical regions.  Collaborate with marketing and finance to influence the ongoing development of value-added programs that drive attractive and accretive customer partnerships. 


 Responsibilities may include the following and other duties may be assigned. 

 Achieve all strategic accounts business objectives and revenue goals.  Cross functional collaborative experience across products in Surgical to align business proposals.  Communicate/ implement Key accounts customer relationship strategy.  Create and implement Key accounts strategy to internal and external customers.  Manage all area budgets and profitability objectives.  Increase Medtronic product sales and corporate relationship through liaison with GPO/IDN sales team.  Develop and maintain active target list of future targets/competitive hospitals.  Conduct meetings and business reviews at key accounts to address issues, concerns, and opportunities Independently and in partnership with the U.S. Market key account directors and VP leadership team.  Interact closely Marketing and other identified key internal stakeholders. Keep the organization informed regarding significant trends, competitive strategies, challenges and opportunities.  Maintain a high level of expertise in US Healthcare Economics, reimbursement, provider merger and acquisitions, and distributor and GPO trends 


Must Have: Minimum Requirements

 Bachelors degree required  Minimum of 15 years of relevant sales experience or advanced degree with a minimum of 13 years of relevant sales experience, minimum of 10 years of managerial experience. 


Nice to Have

 Strong financial acumen (rebate impact, margin profiles, price optimization) Excellent written, verbal skills; ability to develop, present to high-level customers and manage complex business RFP processes, supply chain interaction and conversion processes  Strong Communication, Relationship Building & Collaboration Skills Creative Contract Development Expertise Capable of effectively selling to the C-Suite & Acute Hospital Site of Service Project Management Skills IDN/GPO and/or National Accounts Experience Effective Negotiation Skills & Strong Business Acumen MBA and/or 3+ Years Sales Leadership Experience is a plus Excellent understanding of vendor, distributor, relationship management within the hospital supply chain and personnel management. Excellent written, verbal skills; ability to develop, present and manage complex business RFP processes, supply chain interaction and conversion processes Ability to gain support and communicate with all levels of organization 


About Medtronic

Together, we can change healthcare worldwide. At Medtronic, we push the limits of what technology, therapies, and services can do to help alleviate pain, restore health, and extend life. We challenge ourselves and each other to make tomorrow better than yesterday. It is what makes this an exciting and rewarding place to be.

We want to accelerate and advance our ability to create meaningful innovations - but we will only succeed with the right people on our team. Let’s work together to address universal healthcare needs and improve patients’ lives. Help us shape the future.

Physical Job Requirements

The physical demands described within the Day in the Life section of this job description are representative of those that must be met by an employee to successfully perform the essential functions of this job. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.

Salary And Benefits

A commitment to our employees lives at the core of our values. We recognize their contributions. They share in the success they help to create. We offer a wide range of benefits, resources, and competitive compensation plans designed to support you at every career and life stage. Learn more about our benefits here .

SIP Eligible: In addition to Base Salary, this position is eligible for a Sales Incentive Plan (SIP), which provides the opportunity to earn significant incentive compensation for achieving or exceeding your goals. Learn more about total rewards here .

LTI Eligible: This position is eligible for an annual long-term incentive plan. Learn more about Medtronic Long-Term Incentive Plan (LTIP) here .

The provided base salary range is used nationally in the United States (except in Puerto Rico and select CA locations) and is compliant with federal/local regulations. The pay offered is based on numerous factors and may vary based on experience, certification/education, market.

Experience Level (if available): Director
